memberdef.definition: std::conditional_t<ThreadSafe, std::shared_mutex, Dummy> ecss::Registry< ThreadSafe, Allocator >::componentsArrayMapMutex
memberdef.name: componentsArrayMapMutex

briefdescription.para: Protects component arrays map/list (ThreadSafe build).
Flat list of all unique sectors arrays for iteration/maintenance.
Mapping: component type id -> sectors array (may group several component types).
Dense range-managed entity id storage.

memberdef.definition: std::conditional_t<ThreadSafe, std::shared_mutex, Dummy> ecss::Registry< ThreadSafe, Allocator >::mEntitiesMutex
memberdef.name: mEntitiesMutex

briefdescription.para: Protects entities container (ThreadSafe build).

memberdef.definition: static FORCE_INLINE ECSType ecss::Registry< ThreadSafe, Allocator >::componentTypeId
memberdef.name: componentTypeId

briefdescription.para: Get a stable numeric type id for component T.
Add or overwrite a component T for an entity.

parameterdescription.para: Entity id (also used logically as sector id).

simplesect.para: Pointer to the stored component.
Overwrites existing component instance (destructive assign semantics inside sector).

briefdescription.para: Bulk add components via generator functor under a single write lock (thread-safe build).

parameterdescription.para: Callable returning std::pair<EntityId,T>. Return {INVALID_ID, {}} to stop.
Generator invoked repeatedly while lock is held.

simplesect.para: Optimizes many insertions by avoiding enter/leave lock per element.

briefdescription.para: Clear all component arrays and remove all entities.

simplesect.para: Does not shrink capacity.
contains(id)==false for any previously allocated entity.
True if registry currently owns entityId.

briefdescription.para: Defragment all arrays (compacts fragmented dead slots).

simplesect.para: Can be expensive if many arrays large ï¿½ schedule during low frame-load moments.

briefdescription.para: Defragment the container for component T (if it exists).
Destroy component T for a single entity (does nothing if not present).
Destroy component T for a batch of entities.

parameterdescription.para: Entity id list (will be sorted and truncated to valid sector capacity).

simplesect.para: Modifies the input vector (sorting, trimming out-of-range ids).
Pins are waited if thread-safe; call outside tight critical paths if possible.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a batch of entities and all their components (sequential per-array).

simplesect.para: Safe to call while other threads query (ThreadSafe=true).
No parallelization here to avoid thread lifetime complexity.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a single entity and all of its components.

parameterdescription.para: Entity to remove (ignored if not owned). @complexity O(A) with A = number of component arrays.

briefdescription.para: Apply a function to each entity in a list, pinning requested component types (thread-safe build).

simplesect.para: Skips entities missing any main pinned component (pointer passed may be nullptr for non-main).

memberdef.name: getAllEntities

briefdescription.para: Snapshot all entity ids (copy).

memberdef.definition: Memory::SectorsArray< ThreadSafe, Allocator > * ecss::Registry< ThreadSafe, Allocator >::getComponentContainer
memberdef.name: getComponentContainer

briefdescription.para: Get (or lazily create) the sectors container for component T.

simplesect.para: Pointer to container holding (possibly grouped) T.
Will implicitly register a single-type array if not pre-registered.

briefdescription.para: Check if an entity has a live component T.

simplesect.para: True if the component exists and is alive; false otherwise. @complexity O(1). @thread_safety Locking/pinning applied if ThreadSafe=true.

briefdescription.para: Copy-in an externally built sectors array for component T.
Move-in an externally built sectors array for component T.
Pin component T for an entity (thread-safe build only).

simplesect.para: PinnedComponent<T> (empty if component missing).
The returned object must not outlive concurrent modification epochs.

briefdescription.para: Explicitly register (group) component types into a shared sectors array.

simplesect.para: All types must either all be new or already co-grouped; partial mixes assert.
Call before first implicit access to any of the grouped types.

briefdescription.para: Default construct an empty registry (no arrays allocated until first use).
Reserve capacity (in sectors array units) for each listed component type.
Set defragment threshold for component T container.
Allocate (take) a new entity id.
Maintenance pass (thread-safe build): process deferred erases and optionally defragment.

parameterdescription.para: If true, arrays that exceed thresholds may compact themselves.

simplesect.para: Recommended to call once per frame at a stable synchronization point. @thread_safety Internally synchronized.

briefdescription.para: Maintenance pass (non-thread-safe build): optionally defragment arrays immediately.

parameterdescription.para: If true, compacts arrays that request it. @thread_safety Caller must ensure exclusive access.

briefdescription.para: Create a full-range iterable view over all entities with the main component.

parameterdescription.para: Component types to access; first drives iteration.

simplesect.para: ArraysView instance (full range).

briefdescription.para: Create an iterable view limited to given entity ranges.

parameterdescription.para: Component types to fetch; first drives iteration order.

simplesect.para: ArraysView instance (ranged iteration).

briefdescription.para: Destroys all component arrays (each SectorsArray is deleted).
Destroy a single entity across all arrays (internal helper).
Utility: pin multiple components and invoke f(entity, comps...).

memberdef.argsstring: (SectorId pinId, const ArraysArr &arrays, Memory::SectorsArray< ThreadSafe, Allocator > *lockedArr, size_t index)
memberdef.name: pinSector

briefdescription.para: Internal helper: pin a sector from one of several arrays (thread-safe build).

parameterdescription.para: Component type stored in the pinned sector.
Container of sectors arrays to search.
If not null, this array is already write-locked (skip locking).
Index in arrays to pin from.

simplesect.para: PinnedSector handle (may be empty if sector not found).

briefdescription.para: Internal helper: ensure entities vector is sorted & clamped to valid capacity.
Central ECS registry that owns component sector arrays, entities and iteration utilities.

detaileddescription.para:
ThreadSafe
If true, operations use internal locks / pin counters for safe concurrent access.
Allocator
Allocator used by SectorsArray (defaults to chunked allocator).
Responsibilities:
Entity lifecycle (allocate / erase ids).
Lazily create or explicitly register component arrays (can group types).
Component add / overwrite / remove (single or batch).
Bulk entity destruction with all their components.
Iteration via ArraysView over one or more component types.

Thread safety modes:
ThreadSafe == true:
Shared mutex protects component array mapping and entity container.
Pin counters block structural mutation while components are in use.
ThreadSafe == false:
No internal synchronization ï¿½ single-threaded performance focus.

Performance notes:
Component insertion is O(1) amortized (sector-based).
hasComponent is O(1) (sector lookup + bit test).
destroyEntities (sequential version here) visits each array => O(A * log N) for sorting per array prep.

simplesect.para: Entity ids are reused; do not cache them beyond system boundaries without validation.
Use reserve<Components...>() to pre-allocate sector capacity and reduce reallocations.
